meanings.sent1: The baby bawled when she dropped her toy.
meanings.sent2: She bawled uncontrollably after watching a sad movie.
meanings.sent3: The puppy bawled for more treats, trying to be persuasive.
meanings.sent4: The wind bawled through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The child bawled with such intensity that the neighbors could hear.

meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly
meanings.sent1: He bawled for help when he got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The coach bawled instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot bawled back at the noisy children, mimicking their calls.
meanings.sent4: The thunder bawled across the sky, announcing the coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bawled the answer so all the students could hear clearly.
